WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
The Issue Tracker has an ID for each issue created, but commits to the source code appear to frequently reference 5 digit IDs that are meaningless, from the outside looking in.

How can a non-Microsoft employee follow the _actual_ progress of issues filed in this issue tracker?
WorkItem.Summary: Unclear how to follow bug progress

Comments.Message:
Great question.  We still have a number of bugs that were filed internally, but were never mirrored to the CodePlex site, for a number of reasons.

Moving forward, we're definitely trying to be more diligent about filing corresponding CodePlex bugs so external users can follow us as we work against our current backlog.  (We've been making every effort to file new bugs in the open, though.)
Also, it would be great if CodePlex made it easier to either import existing TFS bugs or, at the very least, link CodePlex bugs to commits.  We'll follow up with the CodePlex team about this.
